title.value: GF LOW N ETS AND VARIATIONAL INFERENCE
title.justification: Derived from the title of the paper.
title.quote: GF LOW N ETS AND VARIATIONAL INFERENCE

extractions.description: This paper connects hierarchical variational inference (VI) methods for hierarchical models with generative flow networks (GFlowNets), bridging the two probabilistic frameworks. The authors demonstrate that in specific instances, VI methods and GFlowNets have equivalent learning objective gradients and discuss how differences between the two arise experimentally.

type.justification: The paper primarily establishes theoretical connections between variational inference methods and GFlowNets, supported by mathematical propositions and proofs.
type.quote: We show that special cases of variational algorithms and GFlowNets coincide in their expected gradients.

name.justification: The primary contribution is the theoretical bridging of two probabilistic frameworks in deep learning: hierarchical variational inference and generative flow networks.
name.quote: This work connects variational inference (VI) methods for hierarchical models [...] with the emerging area of research on generative flow networks (GFlowNets; Bengio et al., 2021a).

name.justification: The paper deals extensively with probabilistic frameworks for generative models.
name.quote: This paper builds bridges between two families of probabilistic algorithms: (hierarchical) variational inference (VI), [...] and generative flow networks (GFlowNets).

name.justification: The paper introduces GFlowNets in the context of its theoretical connections to variational inference.
name.quote: This work connects variational inference (VI) methods for hierarchical models [...] with the emerging area of research on generative flow networks (GFlowNets; Bengio et al., 2021a).

is_contributed.justification: GFlowNets were introduced in prior work by Bengio et al., 2021.

is_executed.justification: Experiments involving GFlowNets were executed, likely on GPUs, given the context of deep learning and experiments detailed.
is_executed.quote: Our theoretical results are accompanied by experiments that examine what similarities and differences emerge when one applies hierarchical VI algorithms to discrete problems where GFlowNets have been used before.

is_compared.justification: GFlowNets are compared with hierarchical VI methods both theoretically and experimentally.
is_compared.quote: These experiments serve two purposes. First, they supply a missing hierarchical VI baseline for problems where GFlowNets have been used in past work.
